message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with coding theory and its applications to locally correctable and testable codes, which are typically studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and data structures (cs.DS) communities. The paper also involves the study of multivariate polynomials, which is a topic of interest in computational complexity (cs.CC) and cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the paper introduces a new notion of locality called the $t$-disjoint-repair-group property, which is related to distributed computing and network coding, and may be of interest to researchers in the systems and networking (cs.SI) community.
